title: Understanding the Gibbs Reflective Cycle
text: The Gibbs Reflective Cycle is a framework for examining experiences. It encourages a structured reflection process.

title: Step 1: Description
text: Start by describing the situation. What happened? Who was involved? What was the context?

title: Step 2: Feelings
text: Reflect on the emotions you experienced during the situation. How did it make you feel?

title: Step 3: Evaluation
text: Evaluate the situation. What was good about the experience? What was not so good?

title: Step 4: Analysis
text: Analyze the situation to determine what you can learn from it. Why did things happen the way they did?

title: Step 5: Conclusion
text: Conclude what could be done differently in the future. What skills do you need to develop?

title: Step 6: Action Plan
text: Develop an action plan to improve handling similar situations in the future. What will you do next time?
